source.notes: Claims extracted to demonstrate Applied AI Research Translation workflow; refine quotes + line references as needed.

claims.claim_text: Multi-agent LLM systems exhibit systemic failure modes (coordination collapse, feedback loops, incentive misalignment) that can worsen reliability relative to single-agent designs.

operationalization.task: Enumerate failure modes and map them to controllability requirements for production.

testability.eval_hint: This paper is primarily diagnostic; translation depends on finding a bounded, controllable decision-support task.

claims.claim_text: As the number of interacting agents increases, attribution of responsibility becomes harder, increasing governance and audit risk in regulated environments.

operationalization.task: Assess accountability traceability for multi-agent workflows vs single-owner decision support.

testability.eval_hint: Score traceability using an audit rubric; compare alternative designs.
